newsitem.title: MEXICO: Portugal leader seeks closer Europe-Mexico links.
newsitem.headline: Portugal leader seeks closer Europe-Mexico links.

text.p: Portuguese Prime Minister Antonio Guterres, starting a four-day visit to Mexico Wednesday, said its aim was to inject new life into Mexico-European relations.

"This visit has a goal...of giving a new impulse to the relationship Mexico has with the European Union," Guterres said at an official welcoming ceremony with Mexican President Ernesto Zedillo in the National Palace.
Mexico is negotiating a free-trade accord with the European Union.
Zedillo and Guterres signed bilateral accords on tourism and air transport, political links and visa requirements for diplomats.
Guterres was scheduled Thursday to visit the central states of Veracruz and Hidalgo and Friday to fly on to Santiago, Chile, for an Iberoamerican summit.
